question: H.R. 30: Save American Workers Act of 2015
question_details: On Passage of the Bill in the House

related_bill.current_status_description: This bill passed in the House on January 8, 2015 and goes to the Senate next for consideration.
major_actions: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

<action datetime="2015-01-06" state="REFERRED">
      <text>Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.</text>
    </action>
On passage Passed by recorded vote: 252 - 172 (Roll no. 14).

<vote how="roll" type="vote" roll="14" datetime="2015-01-08T16:17:00-05:00" where="h" result="pass" state="PASS_OVER:HOUSE">
      <text>On passage Passed by recorded vote: 252 - 172 (Roll no. 14).</text>
      <reference ref="CR H125-126" label="text"/>
    </vote>
related_bill.title: H.R. 30: Save American Workers Act of 2015
titles: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 30-hour threshold for classification as a full-time employee for purposes of the employer mandate in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and replace it with 40 hours.
